Name: Minsk
Description: Minsk is the capital and largest city of Belarus, known for its Soviet-era architecture, cultural institutions, and vibrant city life.

Name: Brest
Description: Brest is located in the western part of Belarus and is famous for its historical sites, including the Brest Fortress, a symbol of Soviet resistance during World War II.

Name: Gomel
Description: Gomel is the second-largest city in Belarus, known for its historical landmarks, parks, and proximity to the Ukrainian border.

Name: Grodno
Description: Grodno is a city in western Belarus, known for its well-preserved medieval architecture, including churches, castles, and historical buildings.

Name: Mogilev
Description: Mogilev is located in the eastern part of Belarus and is an important industrial and cultural center, with several museums and historical landmarks.

Name: Vitebsk
Description: Vitebsk is a city in northeastern Belarus, known for its rich cultural heritage and as the birthplace of the famous artist Marc Chagall.
